intro: Schismatoclada beondrokensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian milkweed, is a perennial shrub native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, featuring five petals and a prominent corona. Schismatoclada beondrokensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
